text: Omg they have awesome food I love their chicken wings. Their spicy noodle soup is sooo good too.

For service, I gave it 2*. The place had 2 tables each with about 2 people to 3. But my drink was not refilled. I almost completed my pho Dac Biet when my eggroll appertizer was served.
Food quality is a 1*. Too much MSG. my tongue tingles after a few spoons full of broth from the combination beef noodle soup. When I finished all the meat served from the bowl, there was too much noodle left. This was an indication of too much MSG and not enough meat. There was only 1 piece of tripe. 2 small pieces of tendon compared to Pho Annie. The brisket smelled old.
The eggrolls were small and only 2 pieces of lettuce given. There should be purple leaves and mint to accompany with the eggrolls. There was too little meat in the eggroll. This is confirmef by the very soft and not firm stuffing. Your bite will tell.
Plastic cup was given for my drink instead of in a glass. This is 2*.
Came here to eat with my friend, had their grill shrimps and pho combination. The grill shrimps is a must try. Will be back to try their other stuff.
Ordered a bunch of snail dishes and they didn't taste fresh at all. I lost my appetite after the very first bite. Didn't try the rest of the menu so the 3 stars are solidly for the snail options.

I was hoping this would be THE Vietnamese restaurant to go to from all the good Yelp reviews. We ordered the mango shrimp salad (delicious), the coconut snails ( we left it practically untouched. It was so sweet. It tasted more like a dessert dish than a savory coconut curry one) and finally the lemongrass chicken was just OK. It lacked the flavor of lemongrass. One of the waiters came by and asked about the coconut snails since it was just sitting there. We told him it was just too sweet. He offered no options to remake it for us, exchange for something else and/or maybe credit for the uneaten order. NOPE! I guess the $11 charge was more important than a returning customer. 

I love to support small businesses around the neighborhood. I hope for their sake, that they actually read some of the negative reviews and maybe attempt to make the simple changes for the better.  As customers, we invested our time to write the reviews, owners should spend the time to read them and see them as constructive criticisms and not insults to their businesses
Excellent service. Great food. Pho, bun rieu, and clams were great! Will try out their hot pot the next time we come. Everything is on point.

We have been here a couple times.  Both times the meals were pretty good.  Here are my ratings:

Environment - spacious and very clean.  Tables are comfy and restaurant is well lit.  We had dinner and lunch here.  Both times, it was not crowded and pretty sparse.

Service - Very good.  Our waiters were quick, polite, and quite courteous.  They also came by a few times to check on us and fill our waters.  No issues.

Food - very good.  We had the following:

1.  Eel hotpot (my wife and mother loved it).  I had the pork chops, rice, and steamed egg.  
2.  The pork chop was cooked to perfection - tender and dry.  The rice was a bit dry and the steamed egg meatloaf was just average.
3. Finally, we also had the shaken beef.  This was also very good.  Would recommend it!

Overall, both meals were pretty good, service was excellent, and it is a good place to  have a vietnamese meal.  Price was average for both meals - inexpensive, but not cheap.

Would highly recommend!

Finally, a place that serves sweet and sour hot pot, and grilled escargot. It is authentic Vietnamese dishes and the taste is up to par. Especially, coming from Orange County where there's so many restaurants that you can compare it to, this place taste as good or even better. The restaurant is neat, clean, and they have superb customer service. They are very attentive and friendly, as well as knowledgeable of the dishes making great recommendations. Definitely recommend this place! Can't wait to try their other dishes.

Finally a Vietnamese restaurant close to where I live that actually has great food. My favorite dishes are the beef stu with rice noodles, pho rare steak and their egg rolls! So delicious. I'm glad the same server Sen still works there since the renovation took place. I'll be here all the time!!
Pho was really good. Only my second time having it. Delivered pretty quick. Ill be eating here more often. The menu looks very enticing and the prices are reasonable.

Stopped by on a whim after work after looking up nearby Vietnamese food places & I was not disappointed. The gentleman at the front who took my takeout order was very accommodating. I made several requests that were not on the menu & he made sure everything was the way I wanted. Their pho is very authentic & their clam dishes are so good! (I got the giant clam). I will definitely be back to try their other clam dishes. 5 star establishment!

I really want to like this place. The food is passable and I think it does taste like Vietnamese food and it's very close to my house so I wanted this to be my take out place. 

The last 3 times whenever I order anything for take out, there have always been a problem. The 1st time they delivered our food but didn't pack it right and all the soup spilled out onto other food - see picture. The second time they did not give us enough rice. Now the third time I ordered 2 pork chop rice and they told me I ordered one. I had to tell them to check the receipt. 

Still sitting here waiting for my food to be made. 

It's too stressful. I hope the management see this and hire competent people or train their staff better.

I think i might have just found my new favorite vietnamese restaurant ! I came here with my friends and we were seated immediately and the place smelled amazing.

We had their clams and snails dishes and they were so fresh and yummy. We tried the sweet and sour hot pot as well. That's definitely a must-try. I had that once few months ago in OC and this place had exactly the same flavor. 

They close on Wednesday and open until midnight during weekend. We will be back very soon.

Everything was so good this
Restaurant looks, feels and TASTE so authentic. Catfish in a claypot has always been my favorite and this place nailed it! The clams were my next
Fav and the soup hot pot was good, just a little
Sweet.

Okay, we did come back here for 5, 6 times in 8 months since the last negative review due to the hotpot. Oh 1 time was for their Cut Chien Bo, Hot Vit Lon Xao Me, we were not hungry too much so we just ordered Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio and Bun Rieu, not special at all. Tbh, their food quality weren't the same between our visits. Lately, they changed the owner and the recipe of Cut Chien Bo changed too. Well, it's super dry and tasteless, the picture below was the old recipe. Nothing to say about the hotpot.

I've been waiting for a place like this to open in Vegas for a very long time. The service was good and the food was great. We had grilled snails and the seafood Thai hot pot that was really yummy. I can't wait to go back with more people so we can try more things on the menu.

This is probably one of the best Vietnamese restaurant I have been too. The food was amazing, the service were excellent and the decor was beautiful!
We order mango salad, spring rolls, egg roll, sweet & sour catfish soup for 4 ppl, snail with coconut sauce and thai chili clam. Everything was delicious, specially my favorite is the sweet & sour catfish soup & snail with coconut sauce ( those two are a must try ) I highly recommended this place as I'm a very picky vietnamese eater! Definitely will be back again!!!!!

Met up with my Vietnamese friends for my first time eating Vietnamese food in a restaurant. I've had some really good dishes at their houses and with their family at their houses. They ordered all the expensive seafood with beers. Said it was the style to eat when drinking. They were so disappointed. Said the seafood tasted like frozen instant dishes & had no flavor. When I tried it, I had to agree. I'm not big on seafood but the food was bland. One of the friends kids had the marinated pork, that was actually good. Best thing on the table was the cheapest. This really seemed like a problem they should care about. I ordered the chicken and shrimp fried rice. Sucks, it came out hella late, the kid and our friends were already done eating. I felt uncomfortable eating while they waited for me. They must have forgot my rice order. The funny thing is, the restaurant at this same location did the same thing to me on a carry-out order I had a while ago. We ordered 5 of their expensive meals and they gave us one small rice. Waited 1 hour after ordering 45min in advance. When I addressed the issue with being shorted rice, she liked to me and said all 5 entree's only get one small rice. I pointed out the menu then she said that they ran out of cooked rice. I would have to wait longer. This last story is only relevant because I was told it's the same owners just different kind of food. I joked with my friends and said, I'll never return here to spend a good amount of money or rice. Lol. If they have a cheap lunch menu I'll give it a try, till then, 1 star. Rainbow is saturated with new restaurants, they need to get it together if they want to survive. The last one sure didn't.

This is the best restaurant that have Vietnamese sea snails in  Las Vegas. The snail with coconut sauce was the best and really addictive. They also have Banh Trang Tron which is my favorite snack. I would definitely come back here if I visit Vegas again 


https://youtu.be/JCyoCybszm8

Been here twice now and still not very impressed, but what makes it worse is that they play their music way too load to enjoy our dinner, they don't know the meaning of "Background Music".  If I wanted load music and dinner, I would go to a bar or club, then they have someone singing karaoke that just ruined my dinner, saw 3 tables get up after the singing started and I wanted to leave too, but my party wasn't done eating.  If they continue this I can see them losing alot of business, probably will never come back again, even if they were the last Vietnamese restaurant in this world.

I really liked the change from Pinoy to Vietnamese, albeit the same location.  I also like the play In the new name "Khong Ten" Or "No Name".  I came for snail dishes and I was not disappointed.  The coconut milk snails was delicious and is perfect with an ice cold beer.  My disappointment is that they gave us the wrong to-go order, instead of Snails in lemongrass, we got clams in lemongrass.  The clams were great, but not I was looking for.  We will be back and maybe I will add the 5th stars.

This place is delicious. This is exactly what I have in mind when I think of Vietnamese food. I have been here a few times and will absolutely come back for more. Their vermicelli salads are the bomb and I highly recommend them.
Best Pho by my house. They're very prompt. To be honest, I've never eaten in the restaurant but they do have a cool karaoke set up! Delicious food

Pho - broth was bland, not enough noodles and meat but plenty of onions
Shaking beef - bland. Meat tasted like it was quick defrosted. No Flavor at all.
Pad Thai - bland

I wish I had taken pictures but it wasn't even worth taking up space on my phone. I would like try the hotpot but Idk if I can bring myself to come back here. Service was poor. I think they were short staffed. 2 people out on the floor on a Friday nite.

I am kind of confused by this place as well. I went here 4 days after it first opened and tried to order hot pot. The waitress told me that the hot pot was a minimum two person order and since I wasn't hungry enough to eat hot pot for two, I ordered a dish of clams and got a beer. Food was okay. Not bad, not good and the menu said it was $8.95. Get the check and was charged $11 for the dish. I asked the waitress why the difference in price and she said she didn't know and that it might be a misprint. Really? A misprint 4 days after you open. I was relatively annoyed at this time but I get it...restaurant just opened. New employees. Whatever. I give them the benefit of the doubt and use cash to pay and wait for the change. The waitress comes out and gives me change and I find that I'm a couple dollars and cents short. I ask the waitress what the deal was and she tells me that they can't give me exact change because they don't have it. At this point I'm furious. Really!? You are a restaurant and you don't have exact change. Give me a break. People, go eat somewhere else. This is restaurant is not worth your time and if you do go eat here, keep an eye on your change. Thumbs down for me.

First time here. We ordered chicken pho and grilled pork and fried egg roll over steamed rice. I am very impressed with the flavor of the soup. I added a little bit of fish sauce and hoisin sauce. saracha. It's perfect. 
The grilled pork was good as well. Very well marinated and charbroiled. Service was very attentive. He came checked on us often and our water and tea never left empty. 4 stars for first time. Next time I want to try their chef specials menu.

Wow! A new  pho  restaurant that just opened on the corner of warm springs and rainbow , just off the 215 freeway . There are quite a few pho places that opened up recently on rainbow , but this place is far above and beyond the competition . The staff was friendly and the food was excellent . The menu had lots of selections to choose from , as we tried all types of dishes since we were a group of 9 . The place was packed for the grand opening and everyone around us seemed to enjoy the food as well . The manager ( Vietnamese guy ) was always checking up on us to make sure everything was ok . Go check it out yourself as this will be our new pho lunch spot in the southwest Las Vegas valley .
My friend recommended this place. I tried the mango salad and it was really good. And their coconut snails were delicious. The pho was also very good. I'll definitely be back!

HORRIBLE..!!!!!!!  Customer services is really bad... we order 2 PHO and egg rolls it took maybe 45min to come our. We were about to leave when the food came out.... and Pho was horrible,,,, taste really bad. NEVER COMING BACK
Tasty and delicious!! Must try their snails. Good service. I like their coconut snails.

It's that time of the year when Pho is craved at least once a week! I just moved to this area and really needed my fix. This place is open late and is amazing! We were greeted by everyone inside! It was open mic night too... They were all getting down!! It was such a good vibe inside. Then the food... mmnnnn yummy! We got the dumplings, pho rare, and Pad Thai. The servings were huge and the flavor was even bigger! Definitely my new favorite spot to get my fix!
I will be back, maybe next time I'll get on the mic.

My friend always raves about viet style snail dishes she has whenever she's in OC, so when we saw this place open, we knew we had to try it. First off, service was decent. Had to ask for water refills a few times, but they're always brought promptly after we asked and our server was very sweet. The owner also came over to our table to check how everything was. We tried snails cooked in coconut milk (a bit too sweet for my taste and so darn hard to eat. Getting those suckers out was hard work lol), mango salad with shrimp (again, too sweet for my taste and the mango was too ripe, so it didn't have the crunchy texture I was expecting. I do love that the dish had fried shallots in it.), baked clams (a simple and good dish. Clams tasted fresh. They added peanuts on top that added to the texture), and fried quails (can't go wrong with fried anything lol). We wanted to try the steamed snails with lemongrass, but they ran out. We went on a Sunday and all tables were taken, so this place has definitely become popular amongst the locals. Total including tax for the four dishes was about $56. I'd go back and try the steam snails and the pho next time. Overall, it's a good enough place to try those special dishes without having to drive to OC!

Finally! The first restaurant in Vegas that sells snails ! Me and my boyfriend came on the 2nd week after they just opened. The place is nice, friendly staff. They have karaoke at night like an actual quan nhau (if ur Vietnamese then u know the drill). We ordered lau Thai ( Thai hotpot) and oc buu (not on the menu but the special board they put in the front) and guess what? It was the best decision I've made for a while hahah The hot pot was sooooo tasty, also the snails  !!!!! Omg I can't say enough! Have to try guys!!!!
The best Vietnamese Restaurant in Vegas ! The hotpot and the coconut snails so tasty!

Coconut curry snails!  I am so there.  We drove all the way across town from Hendo to eat this and it definitely tasted legit!  We also ordered the large grilled clams.  They were fresh and tasty when pairing it with the vietnamese dipping sauce.  But other than that, we didn't know what else to order so I quickly yelped and found out that the claypot catfish was good so we ordered that.  It came with a big container of rice.  It was good.

Service was fast and friendly.

I do want to come back to try out the hotpot.

My second time here this week. My friends and I love their food and service! Great selection for Vietnamese food, especially their "nhau" food items. The staff were friendly and attentive to my needs. Will be bringing my family and friends here again soon!

I have been coming to this restaurant for about a year now. It is on it's third owner. When I first started coming here it was Filipino style food, then it changed owners and became a Vietnamese Restaurant and was pretty good. I mainly come for chicken pho, the hot pot looks good though. I just can't seem to get a group consensus on hot pot. This time I went on Friday night, found out they had switched owners again. I'm wondering if they got a new cook.
To make a long story short I ordered chicken pho and a beer. On the side I asked for crushed garlic, which was brought to me no extra charge. Fish sauce, Hoisin sauce and Sriracha was on the table. I recieved my bowl of pho hot and full of broth, noodles and green onion. It could have used a bit more meat. The broth was a bit on the oily side but bearable. It was a little too salty coming out of the kitchen. I added a light amount of fish sauce but was not able to add Hoisin after that. I added Sriracha. I had to ask for more limes, only one wedge was brought out for my bowl. The black pepper shaker was nearly empty. If the broth had been less salty I would have given four stars. Our server was new to me, polite and prompt however needed to be called back to the table and never checked to see if we needed anything on his own. The photo is of my pho straight out of the kitchen without additions.

Their name has "pho" included to let people know it's a Vietnamese restaurant, but the star here is their hot pot! I got the Thai hot pot and the broth is soo flavorful. It's not too salty or spicy. They include lots of fish and seafood too, and the shrimp are huge! I also got the coconut sea snails, and the coconut stew was thick and really delicious! 

This place is definitely an authentic Vietnamese restaurant, so I can see why there are negative reviews on the service. I'm sure their complaints are due to the language barrier, but even so, their waitresses are very attentive. Our drinks were refilled multiple times and the owner came around to every table to check how everything was! Super nice. 

My family used to drive all the down to SoCal to get good Vietnamese hot pot, but we'll definitely be visiting this place to satisfy our cravings instead now :)
Omg food is so good. Nothing like the other viet restaurants around. The coconut snail is amazing. It's a must try when you come here.
I love the spring rolls.and really clean Restaurant.they have a good service.the owner of this Resto his really nice.

Came here because I was craving snails and wanted to try their hot pot cause I read the reviews and the pictures looked good for the hot pot. My friend and I ordered the coconut nail (1) and the Thai Hot pot for 2. Price was $29.99 for the hot pot for 2 and $10.99 for the snail. The Thai hot pot was delicious. I loved it. Broth was really good. Lots of sides to put into the hot pot. Price was kinda high but if you split between two people it's not bad. The snails were good but the sauce was thick. They could probably improve on the sauce for the snail. Decorations inside was pretty unique. I would recommend this place for their hot pot. We didn't try their other dishes but will be back to try other dishes.

Sweet and sour soup with the cat fish (canh chua) is the best.  Tastes like my mom and grandma used to make it.  Get that and the clay pot cat fish (ca kho).  They have a lot of snails and shell fish, but they're just ok.
Went there with my family and ate there.  The service and food we ordered are excellent.
Pho is not good. Bun bo Hue is salty. But bun thit nuong is really good. I will try Com suon nuong next time.

One of the better Vietnamese Pho restaurants I've eaten at in Las Vegas:) the owner was very friendly and Service was good, helpful and friendly. I'll be back when back in to Vegas, I recommend trying this place the food good :)

My partner and I came in on a Thrusday night, 3 hours before closing, to find the restaurant surprisingly empty. We were the only customer there before another party came in after us, which was a little alarming. 

Looking at the menu, it was a typical vietnamese pho place, with noodles and rice plates. We were more adventurous and wanted to try their seafood  dishes: snails in coconut sauce, blood clams with peanut, some giant snails with gingers, and balut in tamarind sauce. 

The balut was too spicy for my partner but he was in love with the blood clams. My favorite was the snails in coconut sauce. Very addicting :)

The waiter was attentitive ( maybe too much ) because when we asked for our check, he assumed i was done eating and took my plate away :(

I believed this place is pretty new. In Vegas it is hard to find a decent Asian foods, however this place serve pretty good foods compared to any other places. (If you dont want to wait too long at pho kim long). 
I went in as a group of 7, we all were sick so we want the Vietnamese sweet and sour soup, besides pho kim long this is the only Asian place that open late. We decided to give this place a try. Their soup was okay, and they also have coconut snails and many more Vietnamese street foods.

Came to eat with my family, their pho this really tasty. We tried their coconut snails. It was really good!  better than the ones in cali.  I think theyre the only ones in las vegas to have snails(oc). The service was good and friendly. Will definitely be back to try the other items.

Their pork chop is so tender. The price is reasonable and definitely worth it. They do have various kind of seafood ( snails) and chef special hot pot.
It always a convenience being able to enjoy quality food without having to drive all the way to Chinatown.

I did not take any pictures from this place as I was not planning on doing a review. However I felt that the public should be aware that this place is pretty pricey for average food.  

We did not come for the pho but for their shellfish. We ordered some snails, clams and other ocean delicacies. Food tasted ok but portion size were pretty small compared to other places we've been to that served the same type of foods for MUCH cheaper.

We ordered an appetizer mango salad, thai style soup pot and 3 shellfish entrees to share. Again portion size was rediculously small to justify the price. The total bill for 3 of us came out to $100 and none of us were close to being full. It's a good place to come hang out with your friends, relax, kick back a few beers and listen to people make a fool out of themselves on the karaoke but not recommended for dinner unless you're not very hungry of have deep pockets.

I had dinner at this place! I love all the seafood that they have. No need for me to drive down to LA to eat Vietnamese seafood. They have all different types of snails if you are into it. I ordered about 3 different types of snails and it all tasted so good! We ordered the mango salad but it was too ripe. I had better so I was not impressed with that one. One of the snail dishes that has coconut milk (see picture) was a little hard and hassle to eat. If you are impatient like me, then I suggest you not to get it. But the sauce its good tho but I think it should be a little thinner not too thick.

The place just opened for 1 month but the restaurant was pretty busy. Their specialty is also the hot pot which I will try next time!
My favorite restaurant. The foods very good and clean. Nice staffs. Bamboo shoot hot pot so yummi yummi

New place on Rainbow and decided to try it out since it is closed by. Bad decision! Even though there was nobody waiting, the place was filled with dirty tables and we had to wait 10 minutes before getting seated. Seat on the booth and it was wet!!! They don't even bother to wipe it dry after cleaning it with soaking wet towel.  Server is not familiar with menu and can't even answer some basic questions. Food took forever and came out each was like 10 minutes apart. My friend had already finished eating when I finally got my order. Also missed our order of the cooked bean sprouts. The server was rude and drop off the check when I just started eating. Not impressed with the service and food.
 
Update:
I'm giving it two more stars since the owner wrote to me and invite me back to try it out again. Don't really have the time and desire to go back but I appreciate the gesture.

The service is like 1 out 5 .. the food was alright ordered the beef and taste like rubber it doesn't taste like beef at all  .. I ordered an appetizer egg roll, I didn't receive it and when I ask for the tab it wasn't even ranged up I mean she repeated the order why wasn't serve ? Smh I went thru the review that's why I wanted to try this place I guess it wasn't that accurate at all

Ordered take out. Took them 35-40 min to finally get out two pho's an 1 spring roll packed and out. Which I've never in my life sat longer than 10 min before my pho came out at any other diner. They only had about 5 tables sat who had already been served, even the post-mates courier got her pick up before us. Then when I asked for a fresh coconut he told me they were all out and 10 min later they bring a fresh coconut out to another customer. 

Very dissatisfied with the service, I'm actually still sitting here waiting for the 2 regular pho's we ordered. I will never come here again.

Update on food:  Broth was tasteless. They left out some of the dressings. 

Note to self: if the place doesn't smell like pho when you walk in, walk out.

IThis is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant with all the best appetizers and hot pots! Another jewel to open up in the Southwest. Pho Khong Ten is located on the Southeast corner of Rainbow and Warm Springs in the Albertsons Plaza on the side facing Warm Springs. There is always plenty of parking on the outside and the inside is very spacious and clean with lots of tables. Service is always excellent. This is for the most part a family business and the owner Stan is very friendly and welcoming. Staff is very attentive with good recommendations. We always get Tommy as our server who is awesome. 

This place is known for their Hot Pots and their special appetizers. I don't come here for their pho. I'm always here for their Canh Chua Ca (Sweet & Sour Catfish Hot Pot) and Grilled Oysters. If you haven't had it yet then you must try it. Definitely the best in Vegas. 

Canh Chua Ca - Sweet & Sour Catfish Hot Pot - Very Very good. Very authentic just like how my mom would make it. The broth has the perfect combination of sweet and sour with the kick of spicy if you add the fresh crushed red chili peppers that comes with it on the side. It is loaded with thick filets of catfish and all the yummy veggies like okra, bac ha, tomatoes, pineapples, and bean sprouts. They have the serving size options for 1 person (which comes in a big bowl which could easily be shared between them depending on how hungry they are) or the flaming hot pot sizes for 2 or 4 people. 

Com Suon Nuong - Very good! Grilled to perfection. Very well seasoned and deliciously moist. Not dry and tough like a lot of other restaurants I've been to.

Bun Bo Hue - Very good! Broth is perfectly seasoned and comes loaded with a lot of meat, blood, and tendon. 

Grilled oysters - I could eat like 2 dozen of these in a sitting. That's how good they are. Served hot and juicy right off the grill with green onion oil and crushed nuts. Salt pepper, chili pepper and limes served on the side

Coconut snails - great! The ultimate Vietnamese beer food. Love me some coconut snails. Served in a rich creamy coconut milk sauce with a side of toothpicks for you to pick your snails out of the shell with 

Grilled clams - deliciously served like the grilled oysters 

Mango Salad - love this! This is a very refreshing appetizer. 

Hot Vit Xao Me - 2 opened Duck eggs in a tamarind sauce. Good ..aka balut 

Goi Cuon - Good

I love this restaurant. Every time I come back here I'm always trying something new. I love how they're always adding delicious new specials to the menu too. So happy they are close to home. This place is great to celebrate any special occasion at bc they have large tables that could accommodate everyone. It even has a karaoke stage for singing which they turn on for after hours. Good place to come for a few drinks and yummy beer foods.

Great service and food! We got their special sweet & sour soup for 2 as well and an order of mussels. The restaurant was clean and offered great customer service. Will definitely come back to try other items on the menu!

I'm very confused about this place. Reviews say it's super good but I'm shocked that it wasn't. Shrimp Mango salad had shrimp that tasted like it was store bought, Pho broth was bland had to add a lot of fish sauce and egg rolls were very mushy filling. Waitress didn't even fill up my water or ask. Meat portions was good and not bad. Other than that I won't be back
Really good place for Vietnamese food. In love with their drinking food. Great service.

I give this place 2&1/2 stars max. This is my second time here. The first time I came the chicken wings were so salty and dry I thought I ate pure salt. Pho soup wasn't hot. As soon as I put the beef and bean sprouts in, my soup turn cold. This time my caramelize catfish ( ca kho to) has more soup than my Lau canh chua..both are super salty....i normally eat salty, but this is beyond! All my food came before my water. Soup looks good w banana blossom, but it really salty and sour. The waitress give me boxes for to go, I guess I have to touch the hot pot myself. As soon as I was done boxing the food she came to see if I need her help to box. Really??!

I've been to almost every Vietnamese restaurant in the area looking for a good go-to, but they all always just seemed the same to me. This restaurant has its own unique taste and their menu options is what caught my eye the most!! They have traditional Vietnamese food that no other restaurant serves and it's always so nice to come to a Vietnamese restaurant and not get the typical pho, rice plate or vermicelli bowl. On top of that, the servers go above and beyond to meet your needs. So glad I found my new go-to!!!

If you love Pho soup this is the place to get it from! Been to many around town and this place takes the cake. Besides the great food the service is just as good. I would definitely recommend this to anyone out there who loves Pho.

Ordered the Thai hot pot and Ong Choy. Both were decent, nothing too special. Server didn't tell us that the Thai hot pot already had Ong Choy, which is annoying cuz we would've ordered something else. Only complaint is for the amount of food we get, 30 bucks for the hot pot alone is a little over priced. Not sure if we would come back. It was nice to try it for the first time though. 3.5 stars.
The most bland Pho ever! It's like sippin' on water! Their Pho broth has not changed since they served it at their old name DT's.

Took my mom & grandma here for mother's day. Was pleasantly surprised to find a pretty authentic Vietnamese restaurant here in Las Vegas. The place looked fairly new. I really enjoyed the food and they had a large selection of Vietnamese dishes that I haven't had in so long. Definitely will have to come back and try their other dishes. Great location and easy parking.

This place was referred by a friend and it was really good.  Very authentic Vietnamese food that can't be found beside OC.  The Ca Kho tho was delicious and very tasty.  Very satisfied with the service!
